subject: Re: [junit] Best practice - should I fake, or depend on real worl d objects?
msgSnippet: ... If you re testing both, then test them separately. It looks like your deserialization headaches are affecting your ability to test using the deserialized
messageBody:
Jonathan Oddy wrote:

> JB responded:
>
> > Jonathan Oddy wrote:
> >
> >> Does this seem like a resonable direction to be going - or am I setting
> >> myself up for an unpleasant (unforseen) fall somewhere later down the
> track?
> >>
> >> Any thoughts/criticisms welcome.
> >
> > Quick question: what are you trying to test? Deserialization? or using
> > the deserialized object? Both?
>
> The later (is that the right answer?)

If you're testing both, then test them separately. It looks like your
deserialization headaches are affecting your ability to test using the
deserialized object. Stop. Write some tests for
serialization/deserialization. Write some tests for using the object.
For the "using the object" tests, just create the objects in memory and
use them, rather than deseralizing them.

<snip />

> I have a number of deserialisation tests for those classes being
> deserialised - so that's not what I am testing here. I am simply using the
> fact that I "know" I have a "working" deserialisation process on some class
> "A" to speed up my test creation process. It is much easier to data-scrape
> an objects serialised form from a log file and use an object constructed
> from that within my test than to fake it.

Why not just create the object in memory? Why deserialize one?
